For this we’ve considerered the data for one decade on the top five states from above. This would give us insights on the health care and how people have evolved. It can be helpful in predicting useful information regarding infrastructure of a state. Key Trends: 1. Cardiovascular Disease Except for New York state, for all the states the mortality caused by cardiovascular disease has increased. 2. Diabetes in Texas As we can observe from the graph the mortality due to diabetes in Texas was ~69,000 in the year 2017, It increased close to 116,000 in 2018 and then took a dip in 2019 to ~72,000. 3. Data consistency for Diabetes Data As we observed in above point the data trend for diabetes data similar across other states as well. It can be accounted to the way data was collected. And this dip is only seen from 2017 to 2019. This trend is interesting as it could mean that from the years 2017 to 2019 information is either with errors or in actual these states had a dip in the mortality due to diabetes.
